title: Macbook Pro 13" - 820-3115-B - No Backlight on Screen
message:
Hi, i have a customer computer who spilled juice on the keyboard. Some small areas have been cleaned on motherboard with isopropanol.

1. I have green light and FAN spin on motherboard.
2. NO CHIME
3. NO IMAGE

Any suggestions?

thanks

title: Macbook Pro 13" - 820-3115-B - No Backlight on Screen
message:
Check for USB activity.
Also post VCORE voltage.

title: Macbook Pro 13" - 820-3115-B - No Backlight on Screen
message:
im still learning.. 

´Check for USB activity´ how I do that? What voltages do we expect to have there?

title: Macbook Pro 13" - 820-3115-B - No Backlight on Screen
message:
Normally an USB mouse should be good enough; but sometime is tricky.
Is better to use OSX on USB pendrive witk Link LED; if flashes, 100% USB activity confirmed.

VCORE voltage on L7510/20 coils.
Check if you get a drop from 1.15V to 0.75-0.8V after few seconds...

title: Macbook Pro 13" - 820-3115-B - No Backlight on Screen
message:
Thanks for the excellent advice. 

1. USB port is working fine with USB (LED is blinking).
2. L7510 i get 3.3v on both sides of the coil.

What now?

title: Macbook Pro 13" - 820-3115-B - No Backlight on Screen
message:
"L7510 i get 3.3v"
That is impossible!
If you have USB activity, board is working.
VCORE should be aprox 0.75V in this case.

Please provide accurate information...

Do PRAM reset and tell us if get chime at least.

title: Macbook Pro 13" - 820-3115-B - No Backlight on Screen
message:
No Title

1. Tried pram reset,not working, No chime, only the sound from the fan spinning
2. The bord and fan spins but No image, i tried with another screen not working aswell
3. Q7510 (voltage divider) i also get 3v on the output on all 4 pins

title: Macbook Pro 13" - 820-3115-B - No Backlight on Screen
message:
I check louis video [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WHx1mzlwGpY[/url]

Same spot he showed, the Vcore i get 0.2v.

title: Macbook Pro 13" - 820-3115-B - No Backlight on Screen
message:
Its correct now on:

1. Q7510 is 1.8v on output pins: 6,7,8.
2. Q7510 VIN is 12v.
3. L7510 is 1.8v on both input and output pins.

No voltage drop from 1.15V to 0.75-0.8V on L7510..

title: Macbook Pro 13" - 820-3115-B - No Backlight on Screen
message:
You must check VCORE on pin 3 of L7510/20.
3V3 there will fry CPU.
If you really have USB activity, I repeat, VCORE should be aprox 0.75V...

BTW, don't talk about voltage divider on Q7510!

title: Macbook Pro 13" - 820-3115-B - No Backlight on Screen
message:
1. Ok, wont mention voltage divider.
2. L7510/20. I cant find it on the schematics or boardview. Do i search correct like this: L7510/20. Shouldnt it not be only L7510 i search..?
3. the extension: /20.. What does that mean?

title: Macbook Pro 13" - 820-3115-B - No Backlight on Screen
message:
No Title

There are only 2 pins on L7510..??

title: Macbook Pro 13" - 820-3115-B - No Backlight on Screen
message:
Ok i get it: /20 means.

1. L7510 and L7520.

Sorry. i get it now.

title: Macbook Pro 13" - 820-3115-B - No Backlight on Screen
message: Change battery of your multimeter; it can cause higher readings than normal.

title: Macbook Pro 13" - 820-3115-B - No Backlight on Screen
message:
I changed the battery now.

1. The DMM shows 1.6v on both L7510/20 on all 4 pins.
2. No voltage drop from 1.15V to 0.75-0.8V on L7510/20
3. Still NO chime.

Whats next?

4. I checked J9000 connector/LVDS ppv3v3_LCDVDD_SW_F on pin: 2 & 3 (Suppose to be 3.3v). I get NO reading!

title: Macbook Pro 13" - 820-3115-B - No Backlight on Screen
message:
Are you sure about USB activity?
Do you have 1.6V from the first moment charger is plugged in?
Do you get any beep error without RAM?
Test if has external video.
